net.sf.sprockets.google

Class Places

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.sf.sprockets.google.Places

  • public class Places
extends Object
    Methods for calling Google Places API services. All methods require a Params instance that defines the places to search for. Most methods also allow you to specify any number of Fields that should be populated in the results, which can reduce execution time and memory allocation when you are not using all of the available fields. When no Fields are specified, all available are populated in the Response results. Params.maxResults(int) can be used to similar effect when you will only use a limited number of results.

    Below is a simple example that prints the names and addresses of fish & chips shops that are within 1 km of Big Ben in London and are currently open. 

    Response<List<Place>> resp = Places.nearbySearch(new Params()
         .location(51.500702, -0.124576).radius(1000).types("food")
         .keyword("fish & chips").openNow(), Field.NAME, Field.VICINITY);
 Status status = resp.getStatus();
 List<Place> places = resp.getResult();
 
 if (status == Status.OK && places != null) {
     for (Place place : places) {
         System.out.println(place.getName() + " - " + place.getVicinity());
     }
 } else if (status == Status.ZERO_RESULTS) {
     System.out.println("no results");
 } else {
     System.out.println("error: " + status);
 }

                                        Places.Field... fields)
                                                 throws IOException
        Get places that are near a location.

        Required params:

        • location

        Optional params:

        • radius
        • name
        • keyword
        • types
        • minPrice
        • maxPrice
        • openNow
        • language
        • rankBy
        • pageToken
        • filter
        • maxResults

        Available fields:

        • ICON
        • GEOMETRY
        • NAME
        • VICINITY
        • TYPES
        • PRICE_LEVEL
        • RATING
        • OPEN_NOW
        • PHOTOS
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with the Google Places API service

        • location

          • name
          • keyword

        • maxPrice
        • openNow

        • maxResults

        • query

          • "geocode"

      • details

        public static Places.Response<Place> details(Places.Params params,
                             Places.Field... fields)
                                      throws IOException
        Get all data for a place. Normally this will be called after getting a Place ID from the results of a search or autocomplete method. The maxResults parameter can be used to limit the number of reviews and photos. For example, if maxResults == 1, then at most 1 review and 1 photo will be returned.

        Required params:

        • placeId

        Optional params:

        • language
        • maxResults

        Available fields:

        • All except:
          • TERMS
          • MATCHED_SUBSTRINGS
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with the Google Places API service

      • photo

        public static Places.Response<InputStream> photo(Places.Params params)
                                          throws IOException
        Download a place photo. Normally this will be called after getting a photo reference from the results of a search or details method. Always close the stream when finished.

        Required params:

        • reference
        • One or both of:
          • maxWidth
          • maxHeight

        Optional params:

        • etag
        Throws:
        IOException - if there is a problem communicating with the Google Places API service
